channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: MedML: Fusing Medical Knowledge and Machine Learning Models for Early Pediatric COVID-19 Hospitalization and Severity Prediction
item.description: We respond to the national Pediatric COVID-19 data challenge with a novel machine learning model, MedML.

item.title: What is Healthy? Generative Counterfactual Diffusion for Lesion Localization
item.description: This requires training with healthy and unhealthy data in DPMs.

item.title: C3-SL: Circular Convolution-Based Batch-Wise Compression for Communication-Efficient Split Learning
item.description: Based on the simulation results on CIFAR-10 and CIFAR-100, our method achieves a 16x compression ratio with negligible accuracy drops compared with the vanilla SL.

item.title: Self-Distilled Vision Transformer for Domain Generalization
item.description: In recent past, several domain generalization (DG) methods have been proposed, showing encouraging performance, however, almost all of them build on convolutional neural networks (CNNs).

item.title: Cost Volume Pyramid Network with Multi-strategies Range Searching for Multi-view Stereo
item.description: Multi-view stereo is an important research task in computer vision while still keeping challenging.

item.title: Calibrated One-class Classification for Unsupervised Time Series Anomaly Detection
item.description: Our one-class classifier is calibrated in two ways: (1) by adaptively penalizing uncertain predictions, which helps eliminate the impact of anomaly contamination while accentuating the predictions that the one-class model is confident in, and (2) by discriminating the normal samples from native anomaly examples that are generated to simulate genuine time series abnormal behaviors on the basis of original data.

item.title: Equivariance and Invariance Inductive Bias for Learning from Insufficient Data
item.description: We are interested in learning robust models from insufficient data, without the need for any externally pre-trained checkpoints.

item.title: Domain-invariant Feature Exploration for Domain Generalization
item.description: Internal invariance means that the features can be learned with a single domain and the features capture intrinsic semantics of data, i. e., the property within a domain, which is agnostic to other domains.

item.title: MAPIE: an open-source library for distribution-free uncertainty quantification
item.description: Estimating uncertainties associated with the predictions of Machine Learning (ML) models is of crucial importance to assess their robustness and predictive power.

item.title: Improving Adversarial Robustness via Mutual Information Estimation
item.description: To alleviate this negative effect, in this paper, we investigate the dependence between outputs of the target model and input adversarial samples from the perspective of information theory, and propose an adversarial defense method.

item.title: Differential testing for machine learning: an analysis for classification algorithms beyond deep learning
item.description: The execution of the feasible tests revealed that there is a large amount of deviations for the scores and classes.

item.title: GNN Transformation Framework for Improving Efficiency and Scalability
item.description: We propose a framework that automatically transforms non-scalable GNNs into precomputation-based GNNs which are efficient and scalable for large-scale graphs.

item.title: SecretGen: Privacy Recovery on Pre-Trained Models via Distribution Discrimination
item.description: We first explore different statistical information which can discriminate the private training distribution from other distributions.

item.title: Dive into Big Model Training
item.description: We summarize the existing training methodologies into three main categories: training parallelism, memory-saving technologies, and model sparsity design.

item.title: Domain Decorrelation with Potential Energy Ranking
item.description: PoER helps the neural networks to capture label-related features which contain the domain information first in shallow layers and then distills the label-discriminative representations out progressively, enforcing the neural networks to be aware of the characteristic of objects and background which is vital to the generation of domain-invariant features.

item.title: CelebV-HQ: A Large-Scale Video Facial Attributes Dataset
item.description: Large-scale datasets have played indispensable roles in the recent success of face generation/editing and significantly facilitated the advances of emerging research fields.

item.title: Behind Every Domain There is a Shift: Adapting Distortion-aware Vision Transformers for Panoramic Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Panoramic segmentation is under-explored due to two critical challenges: (1) image distortions and object deformations on panoramas; (2) lack of annotations for training panoramic segmenters.

item.title: RA-Depth: Resolution Adaptive Self-Supervised Monocular Depth Estimation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a resolution adaptive self-supervised monocular depth estimation method (RA-Depth) by learning the scale invariance of the scene depth.

item.title: Deep Laparoscopic Stereo Matching with Transformers
item.description: The self-attention mechanism, successfully employed with the transformer structure is shown promise in many computer vision tasks including image recognition, and object detection.

item.title: Revisiting AP Loss for Dense Object Detection: Adaptive Ranking Pair Selection
item.description: However, a deep understanding of how AP loss affects the detector from a pairwise ranking perspective has not yet been developed. In this work, we revisit the average precision (AP)loss and reveal that the crucial element is that of selecting the ranking pairs between positive and negative samples. Based on this observation, we propose two strategies to improve the AP loss.

item.title: Reference-based Image Super-Resolution with Deformable Attention Transformer
item.description: Reference-based image super-resolution (RefSR) aims to exploit auxiliary reference (Ref) images to super-resolve low-resolution (LR) images.

item.title: Active Learning Strategies for Weakly-supervised Object Detection
item.description: On COCO, using on average 10 fully-annotated images per class, or equivalently 1% of the training set, BiB also reduces the performance gap (in AP) between the weakly-supervised detector and the fully-supervised Fast RCNN by over 70%, showing a good trade-off between performance and data efficiency.

item.title: Patchwork++: Fast and Robust Ground Segmentation Solving Partial Under-Segmentation Using 3D Point Cloud
item.description: Moreover, even if the parameters are well adjusted, a partial under-segmentation problem can still emerge, which implies ground segmentation failures in some regions.

item.title: Intention-Conditioned Long-Term Human Egocentric Action Forecasting @ EGO4D Challenge 2022
item.description: Our framework first extracts two level of human information over the N observed videos human actions through a Hierarchical Multi-task MLP Mixer (H3M).

item.title: Black-box Few-shot Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Traditional KD methods require lots of labeled training samples and a white-box teacher (parameters are accessible) to train a good student.

item.title: W2N:Switching From Weak Supervision to Noisy Supervision for Object Detection
item.description: Generally, with given pseudo ground-truths generated from the well-trained WSOD network, we propose a two-module iterative training algorithm to refine pseudo labels and supervise better object detector progressively.

item.title: Domain Adaptive Person Search
item.description: In this paper, we take a further step and present Domain Adaptive Person Search (DAPS), which aims to generalize the model from a labeled source domain to the unlabeled target domain.

item.title: On Mitigating Hard Clusters for Face Clustering
item.description: Face clustering is a promising way to scale up face recognition systems using large-scale unlabeled face images.

item.title: Spatial-Temporal Federated Learning for Lifelong Person Re-identification on Distributed Edges
item.description: Then, the learnt knowledge from edge clients will be aggregated by centralized parameter server, where the knowledge will be selectively and attentively distilled from spatial- and temporal-dimension with carefully designed mechanisms.

item.title: Learnable Privacy-Preserving Anonymization for Pedestrian Images
item.description: We further propose a progressive training strategy to improve the performance, which iteratively upgrades the initial anonymization supervision.

item.title: Object State Change Classification in Egocentric Videos using the Divided Space-Time Attention Mechanism
item.description: This report describes our submission called "TarHeels" for the Ego4D: Object State Change Classification Challenge.

item.title: No More Fine-Tuning? An Experimental Evaluation of Prompt Tuning in Code Intelligence
item.description: Besides, the performance of fine-tuning strongly relies on the amount of downstream data, while in practice, the scenarios with scarce data are common.

item.title: Kernel Relative-prototype Spectral Filtering for Few-shot Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose a framework of spectral filtering (shrinkage) for measuring the difference between query samples and prototypes, or namely the relative prototypes, in a reproducing kernel Hilbert space (RKHS).

item.title: PatchRD: Detail-Preserving Shape Completion by Learning Patch Retrieval and Deformation
item.description: Our key insight is to copy and deform patches from the partial input to complete missing regions.

item.title: CODiT: Conformal Out-of-Distribution Detection in Time-Series Data
item.description: Machine learning models are prone to making incorrect predictions on inputs that are far from the training distribution.

item.title: A Priority Map for Vision-and-Language Navigation with Trajectory Plans and Feature-Location Cues
item.description: In a busy city street, a pedestrian surrounded by distractions can pick out a single sign if it is relevant to their route.

item.title: Reliable amortized variational inference with physics-based latent distribution correction
item.description: As such, we propose to increase the resilience of amortized variational inference when faced with data distribution shift via a physics-based correction to the conditional normalizing flow latent distribution.

item.title: Label-Guided Auxiliary Training Improves 3D Object Detector
item.description: Detecting 3D objects from point clouds is a practical yet challenging task that has attracted increasing attention recently.

item.title: SimAM: A Simple, Parameter-Free Attention Module for Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: Another advantage of the module is that most of the operators are selected based on the solution to the defined energy function, avoiding too many efforts for structure tuning.

item.title: Unstructured Road Segmentation using Hypercolumn based Random Forests of Local experts
item.description: We propose a method to detect and segment roads with a random forest classifier of local experts with superpixel based machine-learned features.

item.title: Contrastive Monotonic Pixel-Level Modulation
item.description: Continuous one-to-many mapping is a less investigated yet important task in both low-level visions and neural image translation.

item.title: Multimodal Emotion Recognition with Modality-Pairwise Unsupervised Contrastive Loss
item.description: Our method, as being based on contrastive loss between pairwise modalities, is the first attempt in MER literature.

item.title: When Counting Meets HMER: Counting-Aware Network for Handwritten Mathematical Expression Recognition
item.description: Recently, most handwritten mathematical expression recognition (HMER) methods adopt the encoder-decoder networks, which directly predict the markup sequences from formula images with the attention mechanism.

item.title: Exploring the Impact of Temporal Bias in Point-of-Interest Recommendation
item.description: Recommending appropriate travel destinations to consumers based on contextual information such as their check-in time and location is a primary objective of Point-of-Interest (POI) recommender systems.

item.title: $μ\text{KG}$: A Library for Multi-source Knowledge Graph Embeddings and Applications
item.description: It is useful for a thorough comparison and analysis of various embedding models and tasks.

item.title: Time Series Prediction under Distribution Shift using Differentiable Forgetting
item.description: Time series prediction is often complicated by distribution shift which demands adaptive models to accommodate time-varying distributions.

item.title: UC-OWOD: Unknown-Classified Open World Object Detection
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel OWOD problem called Unknown-Classified Open World Object Detection (UC-OWOD).

item.title: Learning Object Placement via Dual-path Graph Completion
item.description: Object placement aims to place a foreground object over a background image with a suitable location and size.

item.title: GraphFit: Learning Multi-scale Graph-Convolutional Representation for Point Cloud Normal Estimation
item.description: We propose a precise and efficient normal estimation method that can deal with noise and nonuniform density for unstructured 3D point clouds.

item.title: Driver Dojo: A Benchmark for Generalizable Reinforcement Learning for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Reinforcement learning (RL) has shown to reach super human-level performance across a wide range of tasks.
